item.title: Moats in the Era of Vibe Coding
item.author: john@januszczak.org (John Januszczak)
item.description: In a world where AI tools let almost anyone quickly prototype and ship software, traditional moats are eroding. This article explores 8 durable moats for the AI era and maps them to Hamilton Helmer’s 7 Powers.

item.title: From Discovery to Knowledge
item.author: john@januszczak.org (John Januszczak)
item.description: GenAI is to software development what LiDAR is to archaeology: exceptional at discovery, insufficient for knowledge. The real value still lies in human judgment, context, and accountability.

item.title: The 2025 Strategy Playlist: 10 Masterclasses in Business & Innovation
item.author: john@januszczak.org (John Januszczak)
item.description: From the history of the Vikings to the future of the Metaverse, here are the 10 standout podcast episodes that defined the listening year.

item.title: The Temporal Architecture of Alpha
item.author: john@januszczak.org (John Januszczak)
item.description: An overlay on Alex Danco’s ‘Prediction’ thesis, arguing that business strategy is finally moving from a spatial ‘portfolio’ model to a temporal ‘stream’ model.

item.title: Why Our "Free ERP" Failed (& Why AI Changes the Battlefield)
item.author: john@januszczak.org (John Januszczak)
item.description: We gave Philippine SMEs a free operating system, but they didn’t use it. In this retrospective, I analyze the failure of ERPX through the lens of modern AI architecture and explain why solving the ‘Cost’ barrier wasn’t enough without solving the ‘Effort’ barrier.

item.title: The Architecture of Organizational Soul
item.author: john@januszczak.org (John Januszczak)
item.description: This article argues that true company values are decision-making heuristics imposed top-down by leadership to align culture with strategy, particularly during transformational change. It introduces a value taxonomy and provides two rigorous tests—Reversibility and Pain—to ensure values are costly, concrete, and strategically effective differentiators.

item.title: He Predicted ChatGPT in 2016
item.author: john@januszczak.org (John Januszczak)
item.description: In 2016, Kevin Kelly claimed AI would become a cheap utility like electricity. He was right. We revisit his 12 trends—from ‘Cognifying’ to ‘Tracking’—to give them an informal report card for the current era.

item.title: Are We Stuck in AI Pilot Purgatory?
item.author: john@januszczak.org (John Januszczak)
item.description: Trillions are flowing into AI, yet 95% of enterprise pilots are failing. By synthesizing four major perspectives—from speculative forecasts to rigorous 2025 enterprise reports—this article identifies the five themes defining the current AI moment and what leaders must do to break out of ‘pilot purgatory.’

item.title: The GenAI Divide: Why 95% Still Get Zero ROI
item.author: john@januszczak.org (John Januszczak)
item.description: MIT’s 2025 State of AI in Business report reveals a stark truth: 95% of enterprises get zero ROI from GenAI. The problem isn’t the technology—it’s the approach. In this analysis, I break down the real causes of failure and what leaders must do to cross the GenAI Divide.

item.title: The Emails We Deleted, The Value We Never Saw Coming
item.author: john@januszczak.org (John Januszczak)
item.description: A strategic retrospective on how the corporate storage caps of the 2000s inadvertently destroyed valuable AI training data—and the mandate for today’s leaders to practice deliberate retention.

item.title: If Your Strategy Starts With a Deck, It’s Already Wrong
item.author: john@januszczak.org (John Januszczak)
item.description: Most corporate “strategy” work starts with months of pre-work and thick decks, and never reaches the real question: why did our past choices produce the results they did? Drawing on Roger Martin’s strategy-as-choices framework, I argue that strategy must begin with the gap between intent and outcome and remain the direct responsibility of the executive leadership team.

item.title: Designing Around Constraints
item.author: john@januszczak.org (John Januszczak)
item.description: Explains why Git stores loose objects in 256 subdirectories keyed by the first two hash characters and how that simple layout optimizes filesystem performance and scalability.

item.title: The Original Blockchain Was Carved in Stone
item.author: john@januszczak.org (John Januszczak)
item.description: Long before digital wallets, the people of Yap solved the hardest problems in finance using 4-ton limestone rocks. This article explores how ancient ‘Rai’ stones utilized the same principles—scarcity, consensus, and proof-of-work—that underpin modern digital currencies and blockchain technology today.

item.title: AIrSpace
item.author: john@januszczak.org (John Januszczak)
item.description: Argues that AI risks driving banks toward visual and experiential sameness—‘AIrSpace’—and challenges leaders to preserve differentiation through vision, brand, and execution.

item.title: Reshaping the Future of Banking & Finance
item.author: john@januszczak.org (John Januszczak)
item.description: The Asian Banker provides a comprehensive overview of the ’triad of disruption’ facing financial institutions today. The article details how the simultaneous maturation of Generative AI, Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDCs), and decentralized architectures is moving beyond experimentation to become the core infrastructure of future finance.

item.title: The Next Chapter of the Web
item.author: john@januszczak.org (John Januszczak)
item.description: The internet’s ‘original sin’ was the lack of a native payment layer. This report explores x402, a new protocol that utilizes the HTTP 402 status code to enable instant, autonomous stablecoin payments for AI agents and the modern web.

item.title: Central Bank Digital Currencies will Redefine Money
item.author: john@januszczak.org (John Januszczak)
item.description: An analysis of the global shift toward Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDCs), highlighting the transition from physical cash to programmable money. The article explores how CBDCs—exemplified by initiatives like the Philippines’ Project Agila and the BIS mBridge project—will revolutionize monetary policy through granular control, improved AML compliance, and new cross-border settlement rails.

item.title: Responsiveness
item.author: john@januszczak.org (John Januszczak)
item.description: Ideally, you provide value immediately. When you can’t, you provide speed. Here is the simple math behind high-performance communication that builds trust and loyalty.

item.title: The Future of Finance: All About Embedded, Open, and Decentralized Finance
item.author: john@januszczak.org (John Januszczak)
item.description: An overview of how Embedded, Open, and Decentralized Finance are converging to reshape the global financial landscape.

item.title: The Power of Decoupling
item.author: john@januszczak.org (John Januszczak)
item.description: Explains why designing to interfaces and loosely coupling systems, teams, and processes lets organisations move faster, reduce risk, and test product‑market fit independently.

item.title: Path to Scale
item.author: john@januszczak.org (John Januszczak)
item.description: Strategies for achieving exponential growth in the fintech ecosystem.

item.title: Creating R Packages: What You Need to Know
item.author: john@januszczak.org (John Januszczak)
item.description: Key lessons, impressions, and recommended resources for building your first R package.

item.title: Newspapers and Insurance
item.author: john@januszczak.org (John Januszczak)
item.description: Reflection on parallels between newspapers’ business challenges and the insurance industry’s need to adapt to digital disruption.

item.title: Top 15 Books in the Andreessen Horowitz Library
item.author: john@januszczak.org (John Januszczak)
item.description: Curated list of 15 influential books from the Andreessen Horowitz library covering startups, product, strategy, design, and leadership.

item.title: Simulation Standard for Business Process Management
item.author: john@januszczak.org (John Januszczak)
item.description: A foundational proposal arguing that while BPMN standardized process ‘flows’, the industry lacked a standard for the ‘physics’ of simulation—resources, costs, and time.
